unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Boosts Festive Season Readiness**
normalised: **Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Boosts Festive Season Readiness**

unnormalised: As Onam approaches, Indian manufacturers are ramping up quality control measures to meet the anticipated surge in demand for goods, ranging from textiles in Tirupur to spices from Kerala. Enhanced quality assurance protocols are crucial to prevent defective products from reaching consumers during this peak season.
normalised: As Onam approaches, Indian manufacturers are ramping up quality control measures to meet the anticipated surge in demand for goods, ranging from textiles in Tirupur or spices from Kerala. Enhanced quality assurance protocols are crucial to prevent defective products from reaching consumers during this peak season.

unnormalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) recently conducted a workshop in Chennai focusing on Six Sigma methodologies to improve process efficiency and reduce defects. Key takeaways included implementing robust Statistical Process Control (SPC) techniques and investing in employee training.
normalised: The Confederation of Indian Industry (C I I) recently conducted a workshop in Chennai focusing on Six Sigma methodologies to improve process efficiency and reduce defects. Key takeaways included implementing robust Statistical Process Control (S P C) techniques and investing in employee training.

unnormalised: Dr. Priya Sharma, a quality control expert from IIT Delhi, emphasized the importance of rigorous testing procedures at every stage of the supply chain, from raw material sourcing to final packaging. "Think of it like perfecting a Hyderabadi biryani," she stated, "each ingredient and step requires careful attention to detail for the final product to be exceptional." Failures can result in losses exceeding Rs. 5 lakhs per batch, impacting both profitability and brand reputation. Regular audits and compliance checks are now standard practice, ensuring that quality remains a top priority across the board.
